comments.content:
Closest ready-to-go option: [Korolev](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063416/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/device/korolev), [Decima](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063416/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/decima)/ [Centima](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063416/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/centima) (less)  
Other possibility, custom from [Gotham](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063416/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/gotham/overview). I know it sounds lazy and weird but the rest of this [poster](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063416/http:/cs618321.vk.me/v618321190/520/UC7yo94hRyI.jpg) is set using it.  
Below, illustration of my purpose, from logo to what I suppose to be Gotham.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063416im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-1_5679.png)

thanks, that makes sense

Korolov was the suggestion from whatthefont, I was just intrigued by the flattened bowl of the R, thanks for clearing that up
